ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: This was a great experience because I got to construct my own project/question, design my own experiment, and gain experience working in a lab. While it wasn't necessarily work that is going to be published, it was super valuable to design my own senior research from start to finish. It also gave me specific insight into how activated carbon and biochar can be used as a water filter.
I gained a huge deal of knowledge on enhanced weathering, techno-economic analyses, and other research skills.
I learned how to conduct a research project!

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: I think that the fact the structure is left up to the student and the PI is both a positive and a negative. It was a plus because it allowed me to construct my own project with my own timeline, but I think it could have some more set goals that make me feel like I am keeping pace and have more direction. It is tough because providing more regulation could take away from some of the flexibility, but I think that it should maybe become a little more structured overall. Perhaps a meeting with the DUS/faculty before the start of the semester would be beneficial, as it would give us a picture of what should be completed over the course of the project.

I really enjoyed working with the team most of the semester. The only thingat 5pm the night before my report was due (my report was essentially finished at the time) I was informed that the data I had been provided was wrong and unusable and I needed to find new data. So I ended up spending quite literally 12 consecutive hours gathering new data, performing new analyses, and writing basically a new report.

Strengths: I loved Prof Gentner as an advisor  he was incredibly supportive and encouraging at all steps. The department is also very flexible about the direction/shape of the project, which is helpful your senior year.

Weaknesses: I definitely wouldve appreciate more information about deadlines/deliverables earlier in the semester.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Only for ENVE majors, there is not a whole lot of reason to take it otherwise.
I would recommend this course to another student. I learned a lot and I enjoyed working with the team.
Yes! Your senior project can teach you lots of things you didnt know before, and its nice to complete a project (whether its something youve been working on for years or just for a semester).
